result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
To pay restitution for any out of pocket expsenses for medical and emotional treatment of victim when victim turns age 18.
8/16/21 - Court sets restitution at zero.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with victim. No contact with anyone under age 18 unless probation agent approves.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Obtain Sex Offender treatment and counseling.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution

Defendant Cody J Ford appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Brandon Anderson appeared by phone on behalf of DOC. Court reviews motion filed by Defendant regarding payment of financial obligations, letter from Mr. Anderson regarding payment of financial obligations. Defendant reads letter to Court requesting clarification regarding future restitution. State presents argument. Court will not change sentence or conditions of extended supervision, denies request. Defendant requests that cap be set. Court will not set cap.
Video conference set up with Kettle Moraine for 9/02/16 hearing.
from Defendant to court would still like hearing re: restitution issue.
from DA Pelrine requesting the rescheduling of the 8/03/16 motion hearing. Court reschedules.
Motion hearing on September 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.

to clarify and enforce the current restitution order as ordered via case 14-CF-116. Alternatively the defendant request the court suspend the present restitution order until defendant's victim turns 18 and thereafter until the victim notify the court in writing that the victim has outstanding medical and or emotiional treatment debt(s). Court sets hearing.
from Outagamie Co. DA requesting certified copy of bond.
Motion hearing on August 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
for modification of DNA surcharge order/cost. Court denies motion - assessment added whether or not it has been previously assessed in different case. DTE

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cody J Ford in court with attorney Christopher T. Froelich.  Defendant Cody J Ford in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.

or transport defendant for court on 12/21/15.

Attorney Christopher T. Froelich in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Froelich feels matter will resolve short of trial, asks court to set an anticipated plea date after 12/03/15.  State has no objection to continuance if it's going to be a plea. Discussion regarding whether a PSI will be requested. Atty Froelich indicates a PSI is being done in Brown County, may have to have DOC supplement that PSI with these convictions after he enters a plea here. Court sets plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Attorney Christopher T. Froelich appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Froelich indicates defendant was recently sentence to prison and is currently at Dodge Correctional Institution. Atty Froelich advises of where case is at, requests another status in 30 - 45 days to consult with DA Pelrine about a possible resolution. If matter is resolved, Atty Froelich to let DA's office know to prepare a transport order. If matter is not resolved, clerk to set up video conference.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
from Atty Froelich requesting 6/22/15 hearing be adjourned to September because of the special circumstances with pending cases in 3 different counties. State has no objection. Court reschedules.
Status conference at 09-10-2015 09:45 am

Defendant Cody J Ford in court with attorney Christopher T. Froelich.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Froelich indicates Door County case is not resolved yet, hopes to conclude Oconto County case tomorrow. Defendant also has new charges pending in Brown County. Atty Froelich requests a short adjournment to try and work matters out with the Door County and Brown County case. Atty Pelrine indicates if matter is set for trial, State is withdrawing their offer and there may be added charges. Court grants short adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Cody J Ford in court with attorney Christopher T. Froelich.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Froelich asks court to set matter over for 60 days, would like to resolve Oconto matter before proceeding with this case. State questions what will happen with Door County case at next hearing. Atty Froelich hopes to resolve matter at next hearing, asks court to set status/plea in 60 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.

Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.
